entry.title: Combined summary - Segregated Witness BIPs
entry.summary: The Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP) is a system that allows anyone to propose and implement changes to the Bitcoin protocol. The proposals can fall into one of three categories: Standards Track, Informational, and Process. The Standards Track BIPs are used for significant changes to the protocol, while the Informational BIPs provide guidelines and information for the Bitcoin community.One essential area addressed by the BIP is the Peer-to-Peer (P2P) protocol. This category includes issues such as synchronization, block propagation, transaction (tx) propagation, serialization, and other related concerns. By addressing these issues, the BIP aims to ensure that the Bitcoin network remains secure and efficient.Another significant category within the BIP is the Applications BIP. This category deals with scriptPubKey encoding formats and wallet interoperability matters. The goal of this category is to improve the usability of Bitcoin wallets and enable greater compatibility between different wallets.Recently, a new BIP has been proposed for the Segregated Witness (SegWit) soft fork. This proposal aims to minimize redundant data hashing in verification and cover the input value by the signature. The developers are working on submitting three separate BIPs related to the SEGWIT implementation: Consensus BIP, Peer Services BIP, and Applications BIP. The Consensus BIP has already been submitted as a draft and is awaiting BIP number assignment. The other two BIPs will be drafted soon.Overall, the BIP serves as a framework for improving the Bitcoin network. It provides a transparent process for evaluating and approving proposed changes, ultimately ensuring a secure and efficient Bitcoin ecosystem.
